alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 9:05PM CDT until April 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...EASTERN SHAWNEE...NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS... SOUTHEASTERN WABAUNSEE...NORTHERN OSAGE AND NORTHEASTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 904 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Burlingame, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Carbondale, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Richland, Auburn, Overbrook, Burlingame, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Scranton, Lecompton, Harveyville, Pauline, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Grantville and Berryton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 near mile marker 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 148 and 198. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
